result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tatoo L Herron

10:29 AM Defendant Tatoo L Herron in court.  Prosecuting attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn qualifies for SPD but counsel not appt'd yet. Defn waived time limits. Court set for STC.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

SPD counsel report; defn eligible for services, no atty appointed yet

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

4:01 PM Defendant Tatoo L Herron in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Tatoo L Herron.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
